title: The first wiring map of an insect's brain hints at incredible complexity
description: Researchers have mapped the more than 500,000 connections in the intricate brain of a fruit fly larva. This map, they say, could help scientists figure out how learning changes the human brain, too.

title: A Chicago legend, whose Italian beef sandwich helped inspire 'The Bear', has died
description: The owner of the famed Chicago sandwich shop Mr. Beef had built a reputation for serving the classic dish and showing love for his community.

title: Russia is firing hypersonic missiles into Ukraine that are nearly impossible to stop
description: A Russian barrage on Ukrainian targets Thursday included the use of the Kinzhal hypersonic missile — a weapon that can travel four times the speed of sound and  is thought to be nuclear-capable.

title: Honduran president ends ban on emergency contraception, making it widely available
description: President Xiomara Castro, the country's first female leader, announced the policy shift in the final hours of International Women's Day.

title: A wild cat was found in Cincinnati with cocaine in its system. No, it's not a movie
description: The story of Amiry, the serval found in a tree, happened in January, but was only made public recently. He's been doing well at the Cincinnati Zoo, which reportedly hopes to make him a cat ambassador.

title: 'The God of Endings' is a heartbreaking exploration of the human condition
description: Jacqueline Holland's The God of Endings chronicles almost two centuries of one woman's journey while also exploring the beauty of brevity, the power of love, and the importance of art.

title: La Nina, which worsens Atlantic hurricanes and Western droughts, is gone
description: The cooling in the Pacific Ocean has gone on for three years. Its end is usually good news for the U.S. and other parts of the world, including drought-stricken northeast Africa, scientists said.

title: Yeti recalls coolers and gear cases due to magnet ingestion hazard
description: The main pockets of the recalled products have magnet-lined closures, which "can fail and release the magnets." Swallowing magnets can cause serious injury and even death.

title: Personal information of members of Congress exposed in health data breach
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries said he and Speaker Kevin McCarthy are working together to determine how the personal information was compromised.

title: Ukraine's top nuclear plant lost power for the sixth time. Is disaster imminent?
description: The Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Station was among the Ukrainian structures damaged by a barrage of Russian missiles on Wednesday. Though power has been restored, the threat of nuclear meltdown remains.

title: Texas Tech men's basketball coach resigns after making racially insensitive comments
description: The school said head coach Mark Adams had encouraged a player "to be more receptive to coaching and referenced Bible verses about workers, teachers, parents, and slaves serving their masters."

title: 'Sushi terrorist' and 2 accomplices arrested in Japan after viral prank
description: Viral videos showed 21-year-old Yoshino Ryoga putting his saliva on utensils and sushi and licking the spout of soy sauce bottles at a conveyor-belt sushi restaurant in Nagoya City.

title: Black couple settles lawsuit claiming their home appraisal was lowballed due to bias
description: Paul Austin and Tenisha Tate-Austin alleged that an appraiser undervalued their home by nearly $500,000. They got a higher appraisal after they removed evidence that a Black family lived in the home.

title: Shawn Kemp, the former NBA superstar, is arrested over a shooting in a parking lot
description: People close to Kemp say the case is one of self-defense, after the former Seattle SuperSonics star allegedly tracked down a stolen iPhone.

title: Global declines in democracy may be slowing, Freedom House says in a new report
description: The report, "Freedom in the World 2023," finds that the gap between the number of countries where freedom has improved and where it has declined is at its narrowest in 17 years.

title: Russia hits multiple cities across Ukraine, some with hypersonic missiles
description: Ukrainian officials say at least six people were killed in Lviv and other cities in a Russian bombardment that included advanced Kinzhal missiles, which air defenses can't shoot down.

title: Newly elected Louisville mayor embraces the chance to improve police department
description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Louisville Mayor Craig Greenberg about the findings of a Justice Department investigation, describing a pattern of misconduct within the city's police department.

title: The DOJ found a pattern of misconduct in the Louisville police department. Now what?
description: Louisville Mayor Craig Greenberg spoke with Morning Edition about steps the city is taking to reform its police department — which he says is also some 300 officers short.

title: There are about 3 U.S. train derailments per day. They aren't usually major disasters
description: The U.S. saw more than one thousand train derailments last year, but industry leaders say traveling by rail remains one of the safest methods of transportation.

title: Chaim Topol, the Israeli actor known for Tevye of Fiddler on the Roof, has died
description: Chaim Topol, who has died at 87, was beloved for his portrayal of Tevye, Fiddler's long-suffering and charismatic milkman. Topol long has ranked among Israel's most decorated actors.

title: These 6 tips can help you skip the daylight saving time hangover
description: The lingering jet-lagged feeling you get when daylight saving time begins and ends can disrupt your health as well as your mood. Try these 6 tips from sleep experts to make next week easier.

title: Biden is using his budget as a cudgel in the debt ceiling fight — and for 2024
description: Republicans are demanding spending cuts in exchange for raising the debt ceiling. President Biden is using his budget to show how he could cut the deficit and still fund his pledges.

title: Giant eggshells reveal the secrets of Madagascar's elephant birds
description: New research analyzing eggshells sheds light on the 1,000-pound elephant birds that once roamed Madagascar.

title: Adults complained about a teen theater production and the show's creators stepped in
description: High school theater teachers fear their stages will be the next battleground in the culture war. Plays have been canceled or removed when local officials claim the content is inappropriate.

title: Girls in Texas could get birth control at federal clinics — until a dad sued
description: Trump-appointed federal judge Matthew Kacsmaryk ruled that free birth control for teens from a federal program violates Texas law and parental rights. For now, it's still available in other states.

title: Senate hearing will focus on East Palestine and other recent rail disasters
description: The CEO of Norfolk Southern railroad will likely face pointed questioning over the hazardous train derailment and fire that released toxic fumes last month, as well as his company's safety culture

title: From TV to Telegram to TikTok, Moldova is being flooded with Russian propaganda
description: Researchers warn that Russia is using the same kinds of techniques it tried in Ukraine to destabilize its pro-European neighbor, Moldova.

title: Deadly Russian missile barrage slams targets across Ukraine
description: Russia unleashed deadly rocket attacks that hit critical infrastructure and residential buildings in 10 regions of Ukraine, the country's president said Thursday.

title: No survivors aboard a plane that's been missing for over a month in the Philippines
description: The Cessna 206 took off on January 24 for what would have been a short flight — but it never made it, prompting a desperate weeks-long search through remote mountainous terraine.

title: 3 people are injured in a fiery West Virginia train derailment caused by a rockslide
description: An empty coal train hit a rockslide along tracks in West Virginia on Wednesday morning, causing a fiery derailment that injured three crewmembers, CSX Transportation said in a statement.

title: More rain and snow bound for California as back-to-back atmospheric rivers approach
description: Forecasters say the result could be massive flooding and a potential for avalanches across stretches of the state.

title: GOP leader Mitch McConnell is hospitalized after fall, his spokesman says
description: Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell tripped and fell Wednesday at a hotel and was hospitalized, a spokesman for the senator said. He was admitted to a hospital for treatment, his spokesman said.

title: Congress overturns D.C. crime bill with President Biden's help
description: The Senate approved a GOP-led joint resolution that would overrule the Washington, D.C., city council's recent legislation to rewrite the criminal code for the nation's capital.
